name: Robert Yuen
summary: I am a web application developer (back-end and front-end) that primarily uses Javascript / Typescript and NodeJS in the Serverless/Functions/Lambda paradigm.  I also dabble in Golang from time to time.

about.summary: Hello, my name is Robert and I am a web developer based in Vancouver, Canada.
about.value: I can build static websites (like this one).  I can also build more robust and full-featured ones like the Bank one in my Projects tab.
about.interests: I am interested in data visualizations, software security and distributed systems.
about.exposition: I am an avid attendee of meetups and increasing my understanding of how things work (in general).  I plan on speaking at a local meetup at some point in the future. The topic of which is up for deliberation. I am inclined towards something OWASP and Javascript.

highlights.name: Simulated Banking Application
highlights.description: Web application that lets you make deposits, new accounts, withdrawls and transfers.
highlights.motivation: Kicking the tires with PostGreSQL and Serverless.

highlights.name: JustCounting
highlights.description: React project that lets you filter data and shows charts of said data.
highlights.motivation: I needed to record something so that I could plot it, and it's easier for me to plot something if I am partial to it. So pushups were plotted. Ultimately, the goal of the project was to reduce the barrier to entry towards visualizing the data.  The goal was ultimately accomplished given that there are at least four charts on the site.

highlights.name: Product Hunt Clone
highlights.description: Emulates the home page of product hunt.  Lets you make new Items.  Upvote Items.  Subscribe to Items. Save Items and Dismiss items from your view.  You can sort by category.  The ads on the side hit another serverless function that serves the image associated with the ad.
highlights.motivation: I really liked the Product Hunt UI at one point. So I decided to copy it. Not all of the views are done though. Just the Home page.

highlights.name: Tumblr Front-End Clone
highlights.description: React static application that emulates the layout of the Tumblr Feed
highlights.motivation: I thought the Tumblr feed UI was quite interesting and decided to try to implement it.

projects.name: Golang Quotes API
projects.description: REST API with a series of quotations from fictional people.

projects.name: Social Network
projects.motivation: Just some code for a social network.

projects.name: Quotes API Service, Personal Project
projects.description: A NodeJS API that can be called for inspirational quotes from historic figures.

projects.name: wit.ai Chatbot, Personal Project
projects.description: A NodeJS chat bot that uses the wit.ai library to respond to user queries.  Answers questions about me.

projects.name: YVRUN - Running with Strangers , Personal Project
projects.description: A responsive front-end that lists a number of running groups in Vancouver and their weekly details.

projects.name: YARR Reader, Personal Project
projects.description: An RSS Reader that pulls RSS feeds from a number of reputable news sources and aggregates them all into one place.  My first project using ReactJS.  I tried to emulate the user interface from Flipboard.

projects.name: ThingsAroundMe, Personal Project
projects.description: A web application that gets a listing of events and movie times around you.

projects.name: Newspaper API, Personal Project
projects.description: A NodeJS API for the Vancouver Sun and the Province.  Authentication and API keys are handled using JWT.

projects.name: Email Landing Page, Personal Project
projects.description: A NodeJS web application that serves as a personal landing page.  It collects email addresses from users.

projects.name: Medium Home Page Clone, Personal Project
projects.description: An HTML and CSS mockup of the Medium blogging platform home page.  It was done as a personal project because I thought the user interface was aesthetically pleasing.  There is minimal Javascript use in the project.

projects.name: Instapaper Clone, Personal Project
projects.description: An HTML and CSS mockup of the bookmarking site, Instapaper, main user page.  It was done as a personal project because I thought the user interface was aesthetically pleasing.  There is a moderate amount of Javascript use in the project.
